messages.text:
:factor-form: VMS Business Metrics Report - 2025-12-11 <https://github.com/hellofresh/tam-expansion-crons/blob/reports/reports/vms-daily-business-metrics-report/2025-12-11/|:page_facing_up: View Raw Data> *:bar_chart: VMS Funnel Metrics (Target Date)* ```
Metric             | Current Value   | Day-over-Day | Week-over-Week
────────────────── | ─────────────── | ──────────── | ──────────────
Landing Page       | 499 views       | -6.4%        | +4.2%         
Products Page      | 819 views       | -18.6%       | 0.0%          
Signup Page        | 35 views        | +2.9%        | -7.9%         
Checkout Page      | 28 views        | -40.4%       | -30.0%        
Successful Orders  | 4 orders        | -63.6%       | -71.4%        
``` *:robot_face: AI Analysis*

*Executive Summary:*
On 2025-12-11, the VMS business experienced a significant decline in successful orders (4 orders, -7 day-over-day, -10 week-over-week), despite maintaining relatively stable landing page traffic (499 views, +20 week-over-week). The conversion funnel shows deteriorating performance at the bottom stages, with checkout page views dropping to 28 (-19 day-over-day, -12 week-over-week) and a concerning 14.3% checkout-to-order conversion rate compared to recent performance. *Key Insights:*
• **Critical order volume decline**: Successful orders dropped to just 4 on 2025-12-11, representing a 64% decrease from the previous day and 71% decrease from the same day last week, indicating severe bottom-funnel conversion issues
• **Funnel breakdown at checkout stage**: While products page views (819) and signup page views (35) remained relatively stable, checkout page views collapsed to 28 (-40% day-over-day), suggesting users are abandoning before completing purchases
• **Top-funnel stability masks bottom-funnel crisis**: Landing page views showed healthy week-over-week growth (+20), but the 0.8% overall conversion rate from landing page to orders is critically low compared to stronger days like 2025-12-01 (3.2% conversion)
• **Products-to-signup conversion remains problematic**: Only 4.3% of users viewing products proceed to signup (35/819), indicating potential issues with product positioning, pricing, or value proposition clarity
• **Immediate action required**: The dramatic drop in both checkout views and successful orders suggests urgent need to investigate checkout process, payment systems, or pricing changes that may be deterring customers from completing purchases

messages.text:
:factor-form: VMS Business Metrics Report - 2025-12-09 <https://github.com/hellofresh/tam-expansion-crons/blob/reports/reports/vms-daily-business-metrics-report/2025-12-09/|:page_facing_up: View Raw Data> *:bar_chart: VMS Funnel Metrics (Target Date)* ```
Metric             | Current Value   | Day-over-Day | Week-over-Week
────────────────── | ─────────────── | ──────────── | ──────────────
Landing Page       | 582 views       | +0.3%        | +0.3%         
Products Page      | 1,027 views     | -24.4%       | -2.4%         
Signup Page        | 40 views        | +8.1%        | -27.3%        
Checkout Page      | 38 views        | -15.6%       | -44.9%        
Successful Orders  | 7 orders        | -22.2%       | -50.0%        
``` *:robot_face: AI Analysis*

*Executive Summary:*
The VMS business unit showed mixed performance on 2025-12-09, with landing page views remaining stable (+2 day-over-day, +2 weekly) but significant drops in products page views (-332 day-over-day, -25 weekly) and a slight decline in successful orders (7 orders, -2 day-over-day, -7 weekly). The overall conversion funnel performance indicates challenges in moving users from the products stage through to purchase completion. *Key Insights:*
• Conversion funnel shows concerning bottlenecks: while 582 users viewed the landing page, only 1,027 progressed to products (-25 weekly), 40 to signup (-15 weekly), 38 to checkout (-31 weekly), and just 7 completed orders (-7 weekly)
• Products page experienced a significant daily drop (-332 users, -24.4%) despite relatively stable landing page traffic, suggesting potential product page issues or reduced user engagement at this critical funnel stage
• Weekly order performance declined by 50% (from 14 to 7 successful orders), indicating deteriorating bottom-line conversion despite maintaining traffic at the top of the funnel
• The signup-to-checkout conversion rate appears healthy (95% of users who viewed signup also viewed checkout), but checkout-to-order conversion is weak at only 18.4%
• Overall funnel conversion from landing page to successful orders is extremely low at 1.2%, suggesting significant optimization opportunities across all stages, particularly in products-to-signup transition

messages.text:
:factor-form: VMS Business Metrics Report - 2025-12-08 <https://github.com/hellofresh/tam-expansion-crons/blob/reports/reports/vms-daily-business-metrics-report/2025-12-08/|:page_facing_up: View Raw Data> *:bar_chart: VMS Funnel Metrics (Target Date)* ```
Metric             | Current Value   | Day-over-Day | Week-over-Week
────────────────── | ─────────────── | ──────────── | ──────────────
Landing Page       | 580 views       | +28.3%       | -16.8%        
Products Page      | 1,359 views     | -23.0%       | -7.7%         
Signup Page        | 37 views        | +27.6%       | -56.0%        
Checkout Page      | 45 views        | +18.4%       | -52.1%        
Successful Orders  | 9 orders        | +50.0%       | -59.1%        
``` *:robot_face: AI Analysis*

*Executive Summary:*
On December 8, 2025, the VMS business showed mixed performance with strong landing page traffic (580 users, +128 day-over-day) but concerning conversion rates throughout the funnel. While top-funnel metrics improved, successful orders remained low at 9 completions (-13 vs. previous week), indicating significant conversion challenges despite increased initial interest. *Key Insights:*
• Conversion funnel shows severe drop-off: 580 landing page views converted to only 9 successful orders (1.6% overall conversion rate), with the most significant bottleneck occurring between products page (1,359 views) and signup page (37 views) - a 97% drop-off rate
• Landing page traffic recovered strongly (+128 vs. yesterday, though still -117 vs. previous week), but this increased interest failed to translate into meaningful business outcomes with orders declining -13 week-over-week
• Products page engagement remains relatively strong (1,359 views) but shows concerning -406 day-over-day decline from the previous day's peak of 1,765 views, suggesting potential user experience or content issues
• The signup-to-checkout conversion rate is healthy at 82% (37 signups to 45 checkout views), but the checkout-to-order conversion rate of only 20% (45 checkout views to 9 orders) indicates critical payment or final-step friction
• Weekly trend analysis reveals consistent underperformance in orders compared to the previous week across all recent days, suggesting systemic conversion issues that require immediate attention
